conclusion: Light A and B are emitted from point source S in a pool; Light A has refractive index n_1; Light B has refractive index n_2; Light B illuminates large circular area, polychromatic light illuminates small circular area.
Snell's Law: n_1 sin(θ_1) = n_2 sin(θ_2), where θ_1 and θ_2 are angles of incidence and refraction.
Critical angle for total internal reflection: sin(θ_c) = 1/n, where n is refractive index of medium from which light is emerging.
For light B, the critical angle is sin(θ_c) = 1/n_2.
Light B at boundary of small circle experiences refraction according to Snell's Law; refraction angle must be 1/n_2.
The sine value of the refraction angle of monochromatic light B at the boundary of the small circular area is 1/n_2.
